101.title: About Choreographer
101.content:
Choreographer is a sequencer / composition environment for spatial music. It is aimed at composers or sound artists seeking a flexible and intuitive tool for 3D sound source placement.

The audio rendering engine which is integrated in this software, is designed for sound spatialisation in Ambisonics and implements Ambisonics Equivalent Panning, a technique conceived at the ICST.

102.title: Create a new project
102.content:
Open Choreographer and select New project... from the File Menu (cmd-N). This opens a new window where you can name your project and select where to save it and set the sample rate.

It is recommendable but not necessary to keep the project file and all audio files in the same folder.

103.title: Import audio
103.content:
Select Import audio... from the File Menu (cmd-shift-I) or drag the audio files directly to the arranger window from the finder.

Audio files must be mono and match the project's sample rate

104.title: Place audio in time
104.content:
Drag the audio regions from the pool in the arranger window.

Unlike other audio programs, this software does not follow a multitrack tape recorder model. The arranger window is a blank canvas. The user is encouraged to arrange their audio regions freely in whatever formation (eg. groups, layers, clouds) they best represent the underlying artistic idea.

The are a few possibilities to edit audio regions (cut, split, crop). But there are no further facilities for sound design (eg. plugins or effects).

105.title: Place audio in space
105.content:
Select the audio region(s) to be spatialized in the arranger.

Open the radar editor window (chose Radar Editor from the Windows menu or press cmd-2)

Make sure the editor is set to region mode

Drag the audio region to its intended position.

If you prefer to have numeric control over the positions of the audio regions, open the table editor window (chose Table Editor from the Windows menu or press cmd-3).

202.title: Radar editor window
202.content:
In playhead mode you can monitor the position of each audio regions at the current time (ie. under the playhead).

In region mode you can edit the position of audio regions selected in the arranger or trajectories that are selected in the pool.

203.title: Table editor window
203.content:
In playhead mode you can monitor the position of each audio regions at the current time (ie. under the playhead).

In region mode you can edit the position of audio regions selected in the arranger or trajectories that are selected in the pool.

401.title: Ambisonics equivalent panning
401.content:
Ambisonics is a surround-system for encoding and rendering a 3D sound field. The encoding can be carried out in an arbitrary degree of accuracy (the so-called order).

Normally, Ambisonics requires two processing steps. First, the sound is encoded and converted into a multi- channel format that carries all spatial information. Second, this multi-channel format is decoded for playback, ie converted in discrete speaker signals. Ambisonics Equivalent Panning (AEP) uses a function that is equivalent to the result of a concatenation of encoding and decoding, which takes less computing power.
